text: Austroargiolestes isabellae is a species of Australian damselfly in the family Megapodagrionidae, commonly known as a Sydney flatwing. Endemic to the Sydney district, it inhabits streams and boggy areas. It is a medium-sized to large, black and pale yellow damselfly, often with some pruinescence on adult bodies . Like other members of the Megapodagrionidae, it rests with its wings outspread. ==Gallery== Damselfly (5481488177).jpg | From above Sydney flatwing04.jpg | Female End of a damselfly (5482083578).jpg | Tip of female tail Austroargiolestes isabellae female (11835464054).jpg | Tip of female tail Austroargiolestes isabellae male (11775950884).jpg | Tip of male tail Austroargiolestes isabellae female wings (34788010386).jpg | Female wings Austroargiolestes isabellae male wings (34664713572).jpg | Male wings ==See also== * List of Odonata species of Australia == References == Category:Megapodagrionidae Category:Odonata of Australia Category:Insects of Australia Category:Endemic fauna of Australia Category:Taxa named by Günther Theischinger Category:Taxa named by A.F. title: Austroargiolestes isabellae
